post.body: I try to stick with two categories "Hair on fire" and "Someday/Maybe". Don't always practice it perfectly...
And evolution via natural selection
String theory
What if you have more than 20 actions? Where do the surplus actions go? How would you categorize them? I agree fewer=better.
That webatorinar is really, really painful to watch.
What do you use for benchmarking? Command-line type stuff or do you have (a) favorite utilit(y/ies)?
I guess it depends on how important your hobbies and income are to you.
:( regarding the phone. Is it ugly but functioning? Or just busted?
Regarding the popcorn: hahaha -- that's exactly what happens to food that gets ruined around here. "Oh well, it's compost!"
I've found the SVN builds of Emacs run pretty nicely on the mac. (Not that I build them myself).
No refactoring, no testing=winging it. No refactoring, testing=peace of mind. Refactoring, no testing=scary, both = fun!
"No software is free and spreading that misconception is harmful." The American school system at work. http://tinyurl.com/6oemlo
Note: When writing code in google notebook, please remember that it doesn't do auto-indenting. Kthxbye.
There are four empty espresso cups on my desk. I think that says something in and of itself.
Watching the beginning of what could be up to 10 inches of snowfall out the window over my monitors.
Trying to cut down on the overhead of my morning checkin, without cutting down on its effectiveness.
We've got 5-6 inches of snow on the way.
Successfully compiled the whole Android stack for the HTC Dream. Now I'm just waiting for my developer device so that I can install it.
http://tinyurl.com/35u5y2
Why didn't I look this up a long time ago?
Just discovered I can get borrowing privileges at the U of Minnesota with proof that I'm a grad student at Hopkins. Excellent.
Dissertations in my department are often frighteningly thick. Now that I'm putting mine together I know why. Double-spacing and single-side.
OpenOffice can read in Word files and write them out as (reasonably clean and functional) LaTeX. Who knew?
Lattes are only expensive if you buy them at a coffee shop. At home, they're cheap. http://www.flickr.com/photos/brocktice/3085220790/
I wish I'd discovered the Google Calendar keyboard shortcuts sooner.
As I'm getting back into a real routine, my suspicions have been confirmed -- I need a routine to be truly productive.
Android developer phone arrives today. I essentially paid $400 for a different bootloader. I guess I got an extra piece of hadrware...
My Android dev phone should arrive tomorrow. The funny thing is that because my wife gets my G1, I think she's more excited than I am.
Got a cold, woke up and couldn't get back to sleep, but it's nice to already have an hour and a half of work done by 05:00.
multi-line regular expressions make my brain hurt
I didn't know there was a name for this -- Leaning toothpick syndrome.http://tinyurl.com/6xo2mp

Steve Ballmer, April 2007: There's no chance that the iPhone is going to get any significant market share. Today, iPhone tops Windows Mobile
Home-roasted espresso shot + cask and cream + Trader Joe's hot cocoa mix = crazy delicious
Excuse me weather people, I think there's something wrong with your temperatures -- they all have little 'minus' signs in front of them.
I can't bring myself to copy and paste code, but I'm too tired to do all of the abstraction into a function. Time to do something else.
http://source.android.com/roadmap/cupcake
We bundle Leyla tightly in a blanket because it keeps her from whacking herself in the face and waking up. But now she's an esape artist.
Apparently the php and apache2 in Leopard are borked. Installing from macports solved the problem.
